dotAndLine.network.clientSide

Class ClientCommunicator

  • java.lang.Object
    • dotAndLine.network.clientSide.ClientCommunicator
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Closeable, java.lang.AutoCloseable

    public class ClientCommunicator
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Closeable
    Author:
    Aria :D It is assumed that only one thread can access this. No synchronization considered. A status message is always returned: 1.NoError 2.Error: Do call close() when you are done, close() is compatible with try-with-resources.

                         throws dotAndLine.network.exception.CommunicationProtocolException
        Returns:

      • getUsers

        public dotAndLine.util.Pair<java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String>,java.lang.String> getUsers()
                                                                                      throws dotAndLine.network.exception.CommunicationProtocolException
        Returns:
        .first (- is space) state: -1 = offline 0 = playing 1 = waiting .second Was it successful? If not, what was the error? If controllable error occurs in server, server still will send info to satisfy nUsers messages. But the Error is returned.
        Throws:
        dotAndLine.network.exception.CommunicationProtocolException

      • hasSufficientNPlayers

        public dotAndLine.util.Pair<java.lang.Boolean,java.lang.String> hasSufficientNPlayers()
                                                                               throws dotAndLine.network.exception.CommunicationProtocolException
        Returns:
        .first Answer to "Has sufficient number of players?" .second Was it successful? If not, what was the error? It is assumed that server knows the user and the game which this user is in. If either is empty error is returned.

      • initTheGame

        public java.lang.String initTheGame()
                             throws dotAndLine.network.exception.CommunicationProtocolException
        Returns:
        Was it successful? If not, what was the error? It is assumed that server knows the user and the game which this user is in. If either is empty error is returned. If the number of players is not sufficient, proper error will returned. This method must called when all players say they are ready. (NOTE: The ready buttons must appear only if sufficient number of players are present.)
        Throws:
        dotAndLine.network.exception.CommunicationProtocolException

      • getTheNews

        public dotAndLine.util.Pair<java.util.ArrayList<java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String>>,java.lang.String> getTheNews()
                                                                                                             throws dotAndLine.network.exception.CommunicationProtocolException
        Returns:
        .first List of News' items. .second Was it successful? If not, what was the error? It is assumed that server knows the user and the game which this user is in. If either is empty error is returned. Check in with gotAnyNews precedent to invoking this. 2 kinds of news: 1. someone left in (- is space) 2. information of the moves.
        Throws:
        dotAndLine.network.exception.CommunicationProtocolException

      • sendTheMove

        public java.lang.String sendTheMove(java.lang.String[] moveInfo)
                             throws dotAndLine.network.exception.WrongArgsException,
                                    dotAndLine.network.exception.CommunicationProtocolException
        Parameters:
        moveInfo - [3] 0-the line 1-elapse time 2-mouse info Client side must check the validity of the move. It is assumed that server knows the user and the game which this user is in. If either is empty error is returned.

        Was it successful? If not, what was the error?
        Throws:
        WrongArgException

      • informTerminationOfTheGame

        public java.lang.String informTerminationOfTheGame()
                                            throws dotAndLine.network.exception.CommunicationProtocolException
        Every remaining players should invoke this when the game finished. It is assumed that server knows the user and the game which this user is in. If either is empty error is returned.
        Throws:
        dotAndLine.network.exception.CommunicationProtocolException
